Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Let me start by understanding what P2P typically involves There is usually a sequence of steps like creating a purchase requisition approving it issuing a purchase order receiving goods processing an invoice matching it to the PO releasing payment and then closing the case

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1001 first The activities go from Create Purchase Requisition on 2/1 to Approve on the same day then Issue Purchase Order the next day Then on 2/2 they receive goods get the Vendor Invoice then on 2/5 Match Invoice to PO 2/6 Release Payment and Close on 2/7 That seems standard

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 1002 is interesting It starts on 2/1 with Create and Issue Purchase Order on the same day but then on 2/3 it gets the Vendor Invoice releases payment and on 2/4 receives goods Wait that seems off Normally youd receive goods after the purchase order is issued and the invoice is matched after the goods are received But here the Vendor Invoice is received before the goods are received

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: That might be a problem because the vendor should not send an invoice until the goods are delivered and accepted So this could indicate a discrepancy or a premature invoice

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Also the Approve Purchase Requisition is done on 2/3 after the Vendor Invoice was received That is another issue because you should not approve the requisition until after the purchase order is issued and goods are received

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Approving before seeing the invoice might bypass checks and lead to errors or fraudulent activity

Text: Case 1003 starts on 2/2 creates and approves the req issues PO the same day Then on 2/8 releases payment followed by getting the Vendor Invoice on 2/9 and receiving goods on 2/10 That seems odd because usually the Vendor Invoice comes right after the goods are received Here it is a day later Also the payment is released on 2/8 but the invoice is received a day later

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 1004 is a bit confusing It creates and approves the req on 2/5 then on 2/6 receives goods issues PO then on 2/7 gets the invoice matches it releases payment and closes This timeline is a bit jumbled You typically issue the purchase order before receiving goods but here it is after

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Also the Invoice is received after the goods are received but before the payment is released That might not be a problem but the PO was issued after receiving goods which is unusual Usually you get the goods after the PO is issued

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait in 1004 they received goods on 2/6 then issued the PO on the same day That is reversed Normally you issue the PO vendors send goods then you receive them and process the invoice So this seems wrong because they received goods before the PO was issued

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: This could mean the PO was not used correctly leading to incorrect vendor payment or discrepancies

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Let me recap the potential issues Case 1002 Vendor Invoice received before goods received Also Approve Purchase Requisition after receiving the invoice which is not standard Case 1003 Vendor Invoice comes after receiving goods but payment is released before the invoice is received Also the PO was issued before receiving goods but the invoice is after goods which is okay but the payment is released before the invoice is matched That might be a problem because you should not release payment without matching the invoice to the PO Case 1004 Issuing PO after receiving goods That is a major issue because the PO should be used to order goods and goods should be received after the PO is issued Here goods were received before the PO was created which could mean the PO was not used properly

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So these cases have anomalies related to the order of activities especially around when invoices and payments are processed and when goods are received relative to the PO and invoice timing
